text: Play bingo (add a prize, like candy bars or ice pops)
Play four square
Build a tent or teepee
Build a fairy or hobbit house
Make up a scavenger hunt of around your neighborhood or backyard
Make a castle out of cardboard and other recyclables (see if your pet likes it!)
Lego challenge - build as high as you can!
Draw a sketch or floorplan of your dream home
Make a desssert! Maybe mud pudding, cupcakes or an ice cream sundae?
Invent a fruit smoothie with an unexpected ingredient. Is it any good?
Find a book around that you haven't read yet - give it a try
Host a trivia gameshow! (you can do this over video call too)
Plant something from seeds or vegetable scraps
Have a birthday party for your pet. Give them a hat and a special treat
Put on a household talent show - invite others by video call!
Create a giant robot out of recyclables
Start a creative journal - draw, write, color, add stickers
Learn to pogo stick, jump rope or hula hoop
Make a solar oven (try cooking s'mores or a hot dog)
Play backyard soccer. Make DIY goal posts
Play frisbee golf. Trying throwing it into a bucket, can or box
Create your own coded language or alphabet. Have someone try to crack a coded message
Invent a new sport and try to play it
Challenge yourself to find a toad, stick bug or praying mantis
Learn a new card game, like solitaire, poker, or spoons
Go for a walk, jog or run
Find a smooth or interesting rock and paint a message on it
Paper mache over a balloon to make a planet (Bonus: fill it with candy and use it as a pinata!)
Play pictionary (on paper, or level up with pancake pictionary!)
Trace your body in chalk to draw a life size self portait
Play basketball, knockout or just shoot some hoops
Customize a T shirt (tie dye, fabric markers or paint)
Turn a potatoe or carrot into an instrument. Try to play a song
Find something old or broken and take it apart (telephone, VCR, radio etc.)
Put on a play or film a skit
Watch a movie on mute. Make up the words
Make a windchime out of found objects
Complete a puzzle as fast as you can
Talk a slow walk and try to take ten interesting photographs
Go for a hike
Learn how to make a website
Have a water balloon fight
Try to cover your entire driveway or sidewalk with chalk drawings
Make ice cream or pudding
Make something with origami
Make homemade pasta. Make a fun pasta shape
Fly a kite
Go to the library
Try to identify the birds in your backyard
Make an obstacle course. Try to complete it as many times or as fast as you can
Make paper airplanes. Try to hit a target or have a competition for the plane that flys the farthest and fastest.
Paint some backdrops on cardboard and have a photoshoot
Make homemade pizza. Make the dough or use tortillas
Learn to make balloon animals, then walk your balloon dog
Go bowling, or make a DIY bowling alley in a hallway
Watercolor (ideas: flowers, hot air balloon, mountains)
Play tennis or badminton
Learn a magic trick and perform it
Draw a fantasy animal and make up a name for it
Do some nail art - make a picture or design with nail polish
Sew a pillow, pillowcase or a bag
Start learning a new language
Teach your pet a new trick
Play charades
Make an origami fortune teller
Do yoga
Make your own picture book or scrapbook
Play uno or go fish
Make a new board game or make up new rules for an existing game. Play it
Make puppets and perform a puppet show
Draw a comic
Make friendship bracelets
Read a book in a pillow fort
Make homemade slime
Go apple or berry picking
Visit, volunteer at, or donate to a local animal shelter
Clean out your closet and donate old clothes
Go geocaching
Make a time capsule
Go swimming at a pool or lake
Play a video game for a hour
Work on a crossword or sudoku puzzle
Play floor hockey
Go ice skating
Bike, scooter or rollerblade
Visit a farmers market
Make a pine-cone bird feeder
Make treasure maps and find each others treasure
Setup a lemonade stand
Go fishing
Have a tea party and talk in accents
Camp in your backyard
Go to the zoo
Write to a letter to your grandparents or a friend
Go the beach or a park
Visit a museum
Smash old fruit with a tennis racket
Make homemade jam
Go stargazing. Try to identify some constellations
Play mini golf. Visit a course or make your own course at home.
Wash the car
Play hide n' seek
Dive for toys in a pool
Write a poem or make up jokes
Play marco polo
Play Minecraft
Make a map of your neighborhood. Highlight everywhere you're walked or biked.
Make juice popsicles. Freeze them in layers or mix juices for a twist
Make salsa or guacamole
Make a maze for your pet
Play fetch with your pet
Make and race sail boats
Collect rocks, sea shells or sea glass at the beach
Learn a dance
Visit the aquarium
Play Monopoly or Life
Play Trouble or Sorry
Play Clue or Risk
Play Checkers or Chess
Play Twister
Play Connect Four or Jenga
Play Candy Land or Apples to Apples
Make an egg drop contraption
Make rock candy
Make Oobleck
Make a volcano with baking soda and vinegar
Draw a portrait of your pet
Create your own list of your favorite things to do
Put together a model (a plane, car, ship, etc.)
Picnic and watch trains
Visit a planetarium
Bake cookies (or make no-bake cookies)
Visit a farm
Go to a local historical site
Sort coins and look for wheat pennies
Blow bubbles. Make a bubble wand using sticks and string.
Bounce on a trampoline
Build a sandcastle
Make ice cream floats (rootbeer or orange creamsicle, or invent your own)
Learn all the words to your favorite song
Play Scattergories or Scrabble
Make homemade playdough
Try a new food
Play 'guess that song'
Try to solve some riddles
Watch 'How its Made'
Watch a movie
Have a bonfire and roast hotdogs/marshmellows, or make foil dinners
Play flashlight tag
Learn to do a cartwheel
Draw a new cover for a book you love
Film and edit a trailer for a movie you make up
Make a video for your future self - five years from now, graduation, wedding etc.
Do facepaint
Call a relative and interview them. Learn more about your family's history
Play baseball / softball / kickball
Use cardboard to make a car or marble racing ramp
Make a family tree
Make a house of cards...then topple it
Research a job you think is interesting. Find out more about what they do
Watch Steve Irwin, the 'Crocodile Hunter'
Make a no-sew fleece tie blanket
Cloud watch and draw what you see
Cloud watching pictionary - guess what each other sees
Search for and identify animal tracks
Braid hair (yours or someone elses)

Learn how to juggle
Visit a National Park
Create marble racing tracks out of old paper towel rolls
Recreate a famous artwork
Play freeze tag
Play Red Light Green Light or Simon Says
Go out during / after rain. Stomp in puddles and count worms
Have a building challenge using ALL the Lincoln logs or Legos
Make a flipbook animation
Collect tadpoles and watch them grow into frogs
Make your own whip cream or butter
Go canoeing or kayaking
Set up a slip and slide
Make animal masks out of paper plates
Practice speed stacking cups
Paint with shaving cream
Walk your dog (or a neighbor's dog)
Learn to do the 'cup song'
Study and spot different types of clouds
Fry and egg on the sidewalk
Play dress up or give someone a makeover
Play wall ball
Have a NERF war. Setup obstacles and barricades
Rearrange your bedroom
Play musical chairs
Make sponge paint stamps
Have a pillow fight
Learn to Knit
Make a map of places in the world you'd like to visit
Experiment with coke and mentos
Play dodgeball or volleyball
Play Capture the Flag
Do a Mad Lib
Play 20 Questions
Rewrite the lyrics of a song
Have a relay race
Climb a tree or go rock climbing
Build a snowman (doesn't have to be out of snow!)
Go Sledding or surfing
Play flag football
Go to the beach and search for crabs, clams or sand dollars
Explore tidepools at the beach
Practice doing handstands (in or out of the pool)
Have a squirt gun fight
Visit a petting zoo or animal sanctuary
Go skiing or snow boarding. If its summer, try water skiing!
Visit an arcade or amusement park
Play 'Heads Up' or 'Catchphrase'
Decorate cookies, cupcakes or gingerbread house
Make homemade bread
Start a coin collection. Try to find a quarter from every state, territory and national park
Make a fun background for your fish tank
Time yourself running a 100 meters, then do some math to find our your top speed! Try comparing it to an animal
Make chocolate-dipped bananas or pretzels
Make bagel, english muffin, or quesadilla pizzas
Design your own app
Have a pancake buffet with a bunch of toppings
